ship5

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • ship5.Ship
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Speedboat

    public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a ship in a small simulation system. Made to demonstrate OOP in Java.

    From the coreservlets.com tutorials on JSF 2, PrimeFaces, Ajax, JavaScript, jQuery, GWT, Android, Spring, Hibernate, JPA, RESTful Web Services, Hadoop, Spring MVC, servlets, JSP, Java 8 lambdas and streams (for those that know Java already), and Java 8 programming (for those new to Java).

    Author:
    Marty Hall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ship(double x, double y, double speed, double direction, java.lang.String name)
      Build a ship with specified parameters.
      Ship(java.lang.String name)
      Build a ship with default values (x=0, y=0, speed=1.0, direction=0.0).

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves ship one step at current speed/direction. Units are left unspecified here, so the rule is that x and y are in the same units as speed. For example, if speed is in nautical miles per hour, the x and y are in nautical miles, and move updates x and y the amount they would change in an hour.

      • move

        public void move(int steps)
        Moves N steps at current speed/direction.

      • printLocation

        public void printLocation()
        Reports location to standard output. We will see later that instead of printing directly, you can make a toString method that returns some printable representation, then the external code can print the ship instance and it will automatically use the toString method.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Gets current X location.

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Sets current X location.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets current Y location.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        Sets current Y location.

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Gets current speed.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)
        Sets current speed.

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        Gets current heading (0=East, 90=North, 180=West, 270=South). I.e., uses standard math angles, not nautical system where 0=North, 90=East, etc.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(double direction)
        Sets current direction (0=East, 90=North, 180=West, 270=South). I.e., uses standard math angles,not nautical system where 0=North,90=East, etc.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets Ship's name. Name cannot be changed once the Ship is instantiated (no corresponding setter method).
